Song.title: Nail My Glory
Song.copyright: Words by Isaac Watts Music & additional words by Devon Kauflin and Bob Kauflin © 2008 Sovereign Grace Praise

Arrangement.text:
Intro: [E7 | | Cmaj7 | D6 (2x)]
Verse 1: [E7] No more, my [Cmaj7]God, I [D6]boast no [E7]more Of every[Cmaj7]thing my [D6]hands have [E7]done I quit the [Cmaj7]hopes I [D6]held be[E7]fore To trust the [Cmaj7]merits [D6]of Your [A]Son
Chorus: [E] [ ]Now for His [G]love I [D]bear His [A]name [E] [ ]My former [G]pride I [D]call my [A]shame [E] [ ]What was my [G]gain I [D]count my [A]loss And I [C]nail my [D6]glory to His [E7 | | Cmaj7 | D6]cross
Verse 2: [E7] And by Your [Cmaj7]grace I [D6]will es[E7]teem All things but [Cmaj7]loss for [D6]Jesus’ [E7]sake Oh may my [Cmaj7]soul be [D6]found in [E7]Him And of His [Cmaj7]righteous[D6]ness par[A]take
Verse 3: [E7] All of the [Cmaj7]works of [D6]my own [E7]hands I dare not [Cmaj7]bring be[D6]fore Your [E7]throne My faith res[Cmaj7]ponds to [D6]Your de[E7]mands By pleading [Cmaj7]what my [D6]Lord has [A]done
Arrangement.searchtext: intro verse 1 no more my god i boast no more of everything my hands have done i quit the hopes i held before to trust the merits of your son chorus now for his love i bear his name my former pride i call my shame what was my gain i count my loss and i nail my glory to his cross verse 2 and by your grace i will esteem all things but loss for jesus sake oh may my soul be found in him and of his righteousness partake verse 3 all of the works of my own hands i dare not bring before your throne my faith responds to your demands by pleading what my lord has done
